description: Smallest m such that binomial(m,k) = n for some k.
comments: Index of first row of Pascal's triangle (A007318) containing n.a(A006987(n)) < A006987(n); a(A137905(n)) = A137905(n). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 20 2009
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000
example: a(28)=8 because 28 is first found in row 8 of Pascal's triangle (where the first row is counted as 0).
maple: with(combinat): for n from 2 to 150 do flag := 0: for m from 1 to 150 do for k from 1 to m do if binomial(m,k) = n then printf(`%d,`,m); flag := 1; break fi: od: if flag=1 then break fi; od: od:
mathematica: nmax = 76; t = Table[Binomial[m, k], {m, 0, nmax}, {k, 0, m}]; a[n_] := Position[t, n, 2, 1][[1, 1]]-1; Table[a[n], {n, 1, nmax}](* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Nov 30 2011 *)
prog: (Haskell)import Data.List (findIndex); import Data.Maybe (fromJust)a058084 n = fromJust $ findIndex (elem n) a007318_tabl-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 09 2011
author: _Fabian Rothelius_, Nov 25 2000
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Nov 27 2000
